DOC.brief_summary: The lack subcutaneous partial pressure oxygen ( PO2 ) rise response high fraction inspire oxygen ( FiO2 ) , call `` oxygen challenge test ( OCT ) '' , associate high morbidity mortality human subject . Patients negative O2 challenge test result , indicate flow-dependent O2 consumption might present . Recent report use noninvasive transcutaneous PO2 ( PtO2 ) transcutaneous partial pressure carbon dioxide probe observe relationship low oxygen challenge test value mortality organ failure . The OCT value provide accessible noninvasive method detect early shock . To date , study OCT ICU patient rarely . No one quantify OCT CI , DO2I、ScvO2 . This study explore : 1. relationship patient factor , hemodynamic variable , PtO2 , OCT mortality ; 2. relationship PtO2 index , tissue oxygen index , oxygen Challenge index CI , DO2 , ScvO2 .
DOC.brief_title: Assessment Transcutaneous Oxygen Tension/Oxygen Challenge Test Intensive Care Unit ( ICU ) Patients
DOC.detailed_description: PtO2 index = PtO2/PaO2；tissue oxygen index=PtO2/FiO2； 5min OCT value = challenge 5minPtO2 - PtO2baseline； 10min OCT value= challenge 10minPtO2- PtO2baseline； oxygen challenge index = （10minPtO2- PtO2baseline）/ ( 10minPaO2-PaO2baseline )
DOC.criteria: 18 year age old Requiring artery catheter , pulmonary artery catheter PiCCOplus central venous catheter FiO2 < 80 % SpO2 > 92 % Consent inform Not expect live
